content.text: Clostridial toxic shock syndrome is a severe, rapidly progressive infection typically caused by Clostridium sordellii or Clostridium perfringens. It is often associated with gynecologic procedures, childbirth, or skin and soft tissue infections.

items: Rapid onset of shock and organ failure
Absence of fever in many cases
Minimal or no local signs of infection at the primary site

content.text: Management requires aggressive fluid resuscitation, vasopressor support, and early surgical debridement of infected tissue. Antibiotic therapy is also crucial.

regimenData.notes: Clindamycin is added to suppress toxin production.
